prompt: <description>**Construction Instructions:** **Part 1: Constructing a slanted rectangular prism** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0225, 0.0225, 0.045] Now, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Sketch the following lines to form a rectangle: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.4125, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.4125, 0.0], End Point [0.4125, 0.705] - Line 3: Start Point [0.4125, 0.705], End Point [0.0, 0.705] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.705], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop and scale the sketch by a factor of 0.705. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by rotating it with the following euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Then, translate it by the vector [0.0225, 0.0225, 0.045]. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.27 units. Extrude it in the opposite normal direction with a depth of 0.0 units. **Part 2: Constructing a front-angled rectangular prism** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.045] Now, create two 2D sketches on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Sketch the following lines to form the first rectangle: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.4575, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.4575, 0.0], End Point [0.4575, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.4575, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop and scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Sketch the following lines to form the second rectangle, within the first rectangle: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0225, 0.0225], End Point [0.435, 0.0225] - Line 2: Start Point [0.435, 0.0225], End Point [0.435, 0.7275] - Line 3: Start Point [0.435, 0.7275], End Point [0.0225, 0.7275] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0225, 0.7275], End Point [0.0225, 0.0225] Close the loop and scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7275. Transform the first 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by rotating it with the following euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Then, translate it by the vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.045]. Extrude the first 2D sketch along the opposite normal direction with a depth of 0.045 units. Keep the second 2D sketch as a separate sketch. **Final Shape:** The final shape is a rectangular prism with the following dimensions: length = 0.75 units, width = 0.75 units, and height = 0.114 units. The prism is slightly tilted to the right due to the euler angles of the two coordinate systems.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0.3225). For the sketch, create a new face and add a loop containing the following lines: - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.75, 0) - Line 2: (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.3) - Line 3: (0.75, 0.3) to (0, 0.3) - Line 4: (0, 0.3) to (0, 0) Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the sketch in the opposite direction of the normal by 0.0225 units. **Part 2: Construct a slightly angled rectangular prism.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with an euler angle of (0, 0, 180) and a translation vector of (0.0262, 0.3, 0.3). For the sketch, create two new faces and add loops to each face as follows: Face 1: - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.0225, 0) - Line 2: (0.0225, 0) to (0.0225, 0.3) - Line 3: (0.0225, 0.3) to (0, 0.3) - Line 4: (0, 0.3) to (0, 0) Face 2: - Line 1: (0.675, 0) to (0.6975, 0) - Line 2: (0.6975, 0) to (0.6975, 0.3) - Line 3: (0.6975, 0.3) to (0.675, 0.3) - Line 4: (0.675, 0.3) to (0.675, 0) Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6975. Extrude both sketches in the direction of the normal by 0.3 units. Join the resulting extrusions to form the final shape. The final shape will be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side angled at 45 degrees. The dimensions of the prism are 10 units long, 5 units wide, and 3 units high.</description>

Now, let us proceed to create the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. - Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. - Draw line 1 from (0, 0.0545) to (0.0409, 0.0545). - Draw line 2 from (0.0409, 0.0545) to (0.0409, 0). - Draw line 3 from (0.0409, 0) to (0.7091, 0). - Draw line 4 from (0.7091, 0) to (0.7091, 0.0545). - Draw line 5 from (0.7091, 0.0545) to (0.75, 0.0545). - Draw line 6 from (0.75, 0.0545) to (0.75, 0.375). - Draw line 7 from (0.75, 0.375) to (0.7091, 0.375). - Draw line 8 from (0.7091, 0.375) to (0.7091, 0.4295). - Draw line 9 from (0.7091, 0.4295) to (0.0409, 0.4295). - Draw line 10 from (0.0409, 0.4295) to (0.0409, 0.375). - Draw line 11 from (0.0409, 0.375) to (0.0, 0.375). - Draw line 12 from (0.0, 0.375) to (0.0, 0.0545). The sketch is complete. We have a total of 12 lines in the sketch. Next, we will scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter `sketch_scale` = 0.75. Now, we need to transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified Euler angles and translation vector provided in the JSON. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.0012 units and there is no extrusion in the opposite direction of the normal. With the specified `operation` in the JSON, we join or add material, resulting in creating a new solid body for this part. Height of this part is 0.75 units, width is about 0.0012 units, and the length is 0.75 units. The overall dimension of the part matches the description provided in the JSON.</description>
